title: Chinese on Oce
body:
So, I'm sure it isnt all chinese people, but every one ive seen on Oce have been toxic, not listening, and just flame you if you try and say stuff to them, like, "you are 0/3/0, dont fight the enemy laner" . 
They also refuse to communicate with the team at all, not listening to pings and whatnot, so why isnt there a region lock fo somesort, even just the communication barrier hurts teams. ive palyed with other oce people, and they at least don't flame harder than a wildfire, and try to speak the majority language on the server. is it really that hard to be a good person as a chinese player?

replies.body: This server is for all players that are in our region. In Australia and New Zealand for example there are a lot of international students that live and study here who speak all sorts of different languages. Just because they speak another language does not mean they do not live in our region.

So, i understand that maruader, but really, at least try to speak the majority language on the server, or just not flame for being given advice to not fight. Im not saying all chinese people on oce are bad, but in the majoirty of games ive seen, they feed then flame the team, then spam pings when smoeone else is getting boned by their laner. international student know how to speak english right? I mean as a courtesy to the country a basic understanding of english is  probably wanted, and in most cases needed to actually study in an english speaking country. the thing that annoys me is that language barrier more than anything, the flaming and stuff comes second, but it doesnt help the issue.

It is difficult to communicate with different cultures. I was mainly mentioning why there are other language speakers on our servers. Region locking our server won't resolve this issue as it is mostly players that live in Oceania.

I'm glad you are not generalizing all players just because of a few bad apples. Usually when it comes to other languages you've probably played with way more than realizing as most players in general don't talk too much in game.

We need to make sure our game is a sportsmanlike environment. There is no silver bullet, online competitive games have a lot of friction points that create frustration and anger. We will need to continue to work on our player behaviour systems and educating players why it is important that our community is as sportsmanlike as possible =). Our efforts are targeted at all players.

Half the issue, though, is that anything they type becomes white noise to other players. It needs to be translated or something otherwise we're better off muting them and communicating via pings.

Some guy absolutely chat spamming me in a Ranked match the other day. I had no idea what he was saying. He could have been mad, he could have been asking for help or he could have simply telling us we did a good job. To me, it was just clogging up my chat.

If you want this game to support multiple languages, maybe work in an in-game translator built into chat so that it doesn't polarise your playerbase.

Maori is an official language of New Zealand, and I'm willing to bet that almost no one in NZ who plays league can speak fluent Maori.

Would you tell Maori people not to speak an official language of their country just because they have a skill that the majority doesn't?

Why should it be any different for other people? If the international students you're talking about are anything like the ones I have known over the years, just having a small conversation with an english speaking person is often hard and sometimes painful and frustrating for them, would you force them to do it in their time off as well?

And I'm sure that feeding has nothing to do with the language spoken.

in a fast-paced game like Lol you are always going to revert back to your primary language.
_(imagine being attacked in an alleyway in a foreign country, are you going to take the time to yell for help in a language you barely know, or will you automatically revert back to the language you have known from birth?)_

jsut because it is the official language, doesn't mean its the majority language. i would not, i would like to, however, be on the same page as my team and if they are speaking in boxes and abuse i cant do that. Lots of games have exactly the same issue, with the exact same demographic, even non competitive ones, ARK comes to mind specifically.
Very true

Don't assume all the non English speaking players are from China. That's a little smallminded and racist tbh. While I don't blame people from Garena from playing on our server - you think OCE is cancer? - try playing low ELO on Garena - that's real cancer! 90% of the low players on Garena are girls only playing to gain a 'gamer-girl' tag while looking for boyfriends. I've only played 20 or so games there but after every one of them had anywhere between 1-3 clueless girls giggling in chat, acting all helpless and shit and doing stupid stupid things *and being forgiven for it because they are girls* I uninstalled the Garena client and never went back. That was in every game. Not lying! I know it's not all like that post lvl30 and once you get higher ELO but the getting there was going to do my head in, I could tell. It's very very cringey. 
But... there are just as many non English speaking people on OCE from the Philipines, Malaysia, Fiji, Sri Lanka, India and Singapore (which is technically China *and* Garena) playing here. And don't forget there are a LOT of Asian students living in Au ad NZ while they go to school or Uni and if they are playing with a group of friends they will tend to speak their first language - which won't be English - simply because it's easier. 
But, regardless, I've played with a heap of people living outside the OCE region and, when asked, most of them say they play on OCE because **is** English speaking. Go figure. A few have tried Garena and choose OCE because of the language, they all speak English fairly decently as a 2nd or 3rd language, but mainly because - though Garena is closer and with lower ping - OCE is less 'cancer'.
There's going to be dicks, bads, salty and toxic players wherever you go. Ever play on NA before OCE existed? Try Garena. Have a go on the EU servers, or LAS. One thing most of those negative players all have one thing in common is that they are low skilled players. It's not a language barrier that makes them ignore pings or keep engaging on their enemy laner and dying and not taking advice or threatening to report you if you do give them advice and it bruises their princess egos. It's simply because, whatever race they are or language they speak, they are shit terrible players.  
Unfortunately the only way to avoid them is to only play during peak times so the law of averages means you will get more English speaking players, or to only play full premade with your own friends, or to get better so you get to play with better people... which is hard because playing with muppets like that is like trying to run a 100m sprint on ground made of quicksand. And they are the quicksand.

So, i know they are chinese because i know the shape of the symbols in post game chat, and sometimes they will type a single word, i dont rememebr what it is exactly but i looked it up on google translate and it translated from simplified chinese to english as "idiot" or "fool" or something along those line but not as nice. i have no clue what garena is. i understand where you are coming from, btu in a team full of english speakers the one mid lane yasuo or whatever they may be , being rude, and not actually listening to pings and stuff, is unsportsmanlike conduct and shoudl be reported and punished as such.

Garena controls the SEA (South East Asia) region, which includes China, Singapore etc. 

Saying all Chinese players are toxic is like saying all girl gamers are streamers. Just because that is the only group you see, doesn't mean it's the only group that exists. Just as there are many girl gamers that don't stream, there are also plenty of Chinese players who aren't toxic.

There is a _certain _ validity to the stereotype, the greater _**visible**_ population of Chinese players tends to be the ones that flip their shit and start typing garbage in chat in Chinese. HOWEVER, non-Chinese players are just as likely to do this, we just notice it less because it isn't different, and therefore lacks the distinguishing factors that would prompt us to remember it more clearly.

And all that said, I've also seen plenty of Chinese players engaging in banter with their premade and with the team (even if their English isn't so good) and generally having a good time. Fact is the not toxic ones often see no reason to talk in chat, therefore you can't distinguish them from any other player.

>~~ btu in a team full of english speakers~~ the one mid lane yasuo or whatever they may be , being rude, and not actually listening to pings and stuff, is unsportsmanlike conduct and shoudl be reported and punished as such.

This is precisely the point. It doesn't matter who they are, or what language they speak, if they break the rules, treat teammates like shit etc etc then you **can ** and **should** be reporting them, and they **will ** be punished for it.

(I've met plenty of toxic Yasuo's who were definitely not Chinese, there is also an equally unfair stereotype about Yasuo players, it still does not make it valid)

So, i know they are chinese because i know the shape of the symbols in post game chat, and sometimes they will type a single word, i dont rememebr what it is exactly but i looked it up on google translate and it translated from simplified chinese to english as "idiot" or "fool" or something along those line but not as nice. i have no clue what garena is.

Garena is the Singaporean/Malaysian server. If you think players here are toxic, spend a week over there. I can guarantee that 100% of your games (even at low level norms) will involve fighting over who gets to be JG, who gets to be Yi and more name calling than I've seen since primary school.
I like to jump between maori, chinese and english when i'm chatting. It entertains me and helps me become more fluent in those first two languages, it's funny.

lol that's funny, I have a vivid imagination and I immediately though: 
Team chat - "well done guys :D"
Team chat - "tu meke!"
All chat - "cao ni ma"

(sorry, that's the only phrase I know in Mandarin beside 'ni hao' lol)
No one was dead >.> Not even the dogs... that weren't involved.

I treat all flamers, non-ping-listeners and feeders all the same.

1, /mute

2, try carry the game with the rest of the willing team

Don't be a racist. It's the person not their race or culture.
I see plenty more racist, homophobic and toxic comments from English speaking people than any other non English speaking people combined.

I'm not being racist, they have their own server for a reason, its a legitimate issue, Oce is primarily english speak, its like a bunch of white people going on the chinese server and flaming in broken chinese "fuk u china dog". sorry but if the issue is there it isnt racist.

Aso that video has nothing to do with what i said, thee is an issue, and if more than one person is noticing it enough to put it on the boards, then it should be adressed
Not even worth my time. You are a racist, you can change this and be a better person. I was once a racist but I changed my ways. It's very hard to do but you can change the way you think.
why even comment then?

He is right, he is not racist, he is making a legitimate point that other players from other servers are coming here and giving us shit for playing bad.

It is not an issue with being Chinese, it could be the Koreans. It is simply due to other players on other regions having different play styles and to them, even if you are planning it, to go 0/3 in ANY point of the game is bad.

To me going 0/3 is nothing as long as you are not tons of CS and too many levels behind. If you are purposely doing it, like in Siege mode to stop the enemy pushing and force them to go B or stop them taking a tower, sure, no problem. But if you are top lane and 0/3 by the 5 minute mark, maybe not.

But again, since other servers have different play styles they come here for an easy win and when they see someone do something stupid, make a mistake or have 1 death more than they do, they run around calling you bad and how you should stop playing, I see it all the time too, not to mention the weird ass symbols (no thanks to not having language packs installed) and Asian words that show up in chat, it makes it quite difficult to communicate with them and work together, they just see you as a lower class player and give you shit for it.

Region lock would work, if you are within a certain region based on your IP (yes, it is easy enough to get around), than the game should recognise this and stop you making accounts on other servers, you have your own server for multiple reasons, most importantly lower ping so you can play at your most optimal level.
Thank you, although, i dont midn it as much in siege, more so in ranked. when we were already giving advice to our jungler who's main was banned.
Yeah they talk in boxes or swears nothing else. I've posted about it before and my best advice is just to not play late at night cause that's when the majority of them are on.

Ahahahaha. I see this kind of post every other day.

Yeah, I agree that it's becoming a problem. Their attitude must the poorest I've ever seen.
It's like ARK, the chinese went through that like a plague.

You're not the only one to be raged at by "chinese" players, yes the fk u AU dog etc is common, but thats when you hit the mute button and play on, i was dragged into a 4 man of asian players (me being the only 'AU dog') and this was not premade, i just happened to get queued with them, the amount of rage from them was ridiculous, i was playing shen for the first time and performed better than all of them put together, you don't like em play alone just sit top lane and farm and push regardless of whether you win or lose
